name: Chapter 1: Deployment Models for Cloud Computing
description: Flashcards covering cloud-based, on-premises, and hybrid deployment models using real-world metaphors.

cards.front: You're launching a fully online photo editing platform and want to avoid owning any hardware. Which deployment model fits this use case best?
cards.back: Cloud-based deployment is ideal. It allows you to build or migrate applications fully into the cloud, leveraging managed services for scalability and speed without hardware ownership.
cards.example: A startup builds a SaaS editing tool hosted entirely on AWS, using EC2, S3, and RDS—no physical servers involved.
cards.mnemonic: “Cloud is the kitchen you rent—not the one you own.”
cards.subject: Cloud Support Basics
cards.course: Skills and Best Practices for Cloud Support Associates

glossary.definition: Running all application parts in the cloud—either migrated or built natively using cloud services.
Emulated computing environments running on physical hardware.

cards.front: A hospital prefers to keep all patient data on site and use their own IT infrastructure. What deployment strategy is best?
cards.back: On-premises deployment is best suited here, where all resources and infrastructure are hosted and managed locally for greater control and compliance.
cards.example: A hospital runs its patient management system in a private data center for regulatory compliance.
cards.mnemonic: “Your shop, your rules—but also your maintenance.”
cards.subject: Cloud Support Basics
cards.course: Skills and Best Practices for Cloud Support Associates

glossary.definition: Hosting and managing resources in a local data center controlled by the organization.

cards.front: A retail company wants to keep inventory systems on-premises but use cloud tools to handle peak online traffic. Which deployment model should they adopt?
cards.back: Hybrid deployment fits this use case. It allows the company to retain on-premises systems while leveraging cloud scalability for specific workloads.
cards.example: A store uses local servers for inventory and Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling during Black Friday sales.
cards.mnemonic: “A hybrid is your truck plus a turbo boost from the cloud.”

glossary.definition: Combining cloud services with on-premises infrastructure to support mixed environments.
